noun.description: A room providing a space out of which one or more other rooms or corridors lead, typically one near the entrance of a public building.
A group of people seeking to influence politicians or public officials on a particular issue.

verb.description: Seek to influence (a politician or public official) on an issue.
examples: it is recommending that booksellers lobby their representatives
a group lobbying for better rail services

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense monastic cloister): from medieval Latin lobia, lobium covered walk, portico. The verb sense (originally US) derives from the practice of frequenting the lobby of a house of legislature to influence its members into supporting a cause.
